subject: Re: @BeforeClass vs static{} (JUnit 4+ only)
msgSnippet: Hmm, I only recently started using JUnit (since 4 has come out), so I m not familar with those problems, but I ll take your word for it!
messageBody:
Hmm, I only recently started using JUnit (since 4 has come out), so I'm not familar with
those problems, but I'll take your word for it!

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kevin Klinemeier" <zipwow@...> wrote:
>
> I haven't moved to Junit 4+ yet, but I would guess that one advantage might
> be that the @BeforeClass doesn't give you the ClassNotFoundException
> funkiness that fialures in the static{} block can lead to.
>
> I hate those.
>
> -Kevin
>
> On 5/3/06, eetadic69 <eetadic69@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi all, quick question: can someone enlighten me to the benefits of using
> > @BeforeClass vs
> > using a static{} constructor for my test classes? Actually, I suspect
> > there are reasons to be
> > using both, but I haven't really found any convincing cases yet for code
> > to go into one over
> > the other.
> >
> > Thoughts?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
